What happens to light in an optical fiber that results in total internal reflection?
options: Light travels faster in the core than in the cladding
The core has a higher refractive index than the cladding
Light slows down when it enters the fiber
The core and cladding have the same refractive index
questions.answer: The core has a higher refractive index than the cladding

questions.question:
A sextant is primarily used to measure the angle between two objects, such as
the horizon and a celestial body. What is the primary principle that allows the sextant to
function?
options: Diffraction of light through a narrow slit
Refraction of light through a prism
Reflection of light using two mirrors
questions.answer: Reflection of light using two mirrors
